page.title: 03POTSGROVE
page.content:
A tiny village approached by two minor roads ending at a cul-de-sac by the church, former school, rectory, two cottages and a farm.
In 1377 Potsgrove parish had 38 houses, 44 farms and 190 people. In 1961 it has 17 houses with 69 people. Today there are about 25 people.
{The school,}built in 1897 by the Duke of Bedford, is closed.
{The church,}rebuilt in 1880 is also closed. It is now maintained by a Church of England Trust which looks after disused Churches.
The parish covers about 1500 acres, 60% under{grass,}30%{arable land}and about 10%{woodland.}
